snippet: After weeks of apparent reluctance, the speaker said he was confident that his party’s presumptive nominee would press “our agenda” if elected.
abstract: House Speaker Paul D Ryan, after weeks of reluctance, endorses Donald J Trump for president; modest but unequivocal move is seen as imperative for uniting divided Republican party; after personal discussions with Trump, Ryan says candidate will further conservative agenda.

byline.original: By EMMARIE HUETTEMAN and MAGGIE HABERMAN
byline.contributor: Emmarie Huetteman reported from Washington, and Maggie Haberman from New York. Carl Hulse and Alan Rappeport contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: After weeks of apparent reluctance, the speaker said he was confident that his party’s presumptive nominee would press “our agenda” if elected.

headline.main: Speaker Paul Ryan, After an Awkward Courtship, Endorses Donald Trump
headline.print_headline: Ryan Endorses Trump in a Bid for Party Unity
